page.title: 16Churches, and Clubs.
page.content: The new brick and tile Gospel Mission Hall at Standford has a thriving Sunday School, midweek prayer meeting, and on Sunday, morning communion and a further afternoon or evening service. The small but attractively built and sited Roman Catholic Church at Liphook has a Church Hall used by handicapped Girl Guides and by Passfield Women's Institute, the 40 members of which mostly live in Liphook. Recently formed,'The Standford Singers', 10-14 persons, are keen to entertain local groups and communities with light or serious 4 part music, mostly sung unaccompanied. Passfield Working Men's Club, with advantages of cheaper drinks, has a resident barman. Besides billiards, darts and gaming machines,the whole family can be involved in whist or Bingo, floor shows and outings.
